unnormalised: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways has announced a significant investment of ₹5000 Cr to develop and modernize India’s seaways. The initiative, unveiled on 10/11/2024, aims to boost tourism and trade along coastal routes, benefiting regions like Kerala, Goa, and the Andaman & Nicobar Islands. The project includes upgrading existing ferry services and introducing new, high-speed vessels.
normalised: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways has announced a significant investment of rupee five thousand crore to develop and modernize India’s seaways. The initiative, unveiled on tenth november two thousand and twenty four, aims to boost tourism and trade along coastal routes, benefiting regions like Kerala, Goa, and the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. The project includes upgrading existing ferry services and introducing new, high-speed vessels.

unnormalised: According to officials, the development will focus on improving passenger terminals and navigational infrastructure. "We aim to reduce travel time between major coastal cities by up to 40%," stated Shri. Rajesh Kumar Sinha, Secretary of the Ministry. Routes such as Mumbai to Goa and Chennai to Visakhapatnam are slated for immediate enhancements.
normalised: According to officials, the development will focus on improving passenger terminals and navigational infrastructure. "We aim to reduce travel time between major coastal cities by up to forty percent," stated Shri. Rajesh Kumar Sinha, Secretary of the Ministry. Routes such as Mumbai to Goa and Chennai to Visakhapatnam are slated for immediate enhancements.

unnormalised: Environmental impact assessments are underway, with plans to implement eco-friendly technologies and practices. A dedicated helpline (1800-11-22-33) has been established for public inquiries and feedback. The project is expected to generate approximately 25,000 jobs.
normalised: Environmental impact assessments are underway, with plans to implement eco-friendly technologies and practices. A dedicated helpline (one eight zero zero hyphen one one hyphen two two hyphen three three) has been established for public inquiries and feedback. The project is expected to generate approximately twenty five thousand jobs.

unnormalised: The first phase, scheduled for completion by Q4 2025, will prioritize the development of waterways in the states of Maharashtra, Karnataka and Tamil Nadu. This initiative aligns with the government's Sagarmala Programme, promoting comprehensive port-led development across India’s coastline.
normalised: The first phase, scheduled for completion by Q four two thousand and twenty five, will prioritize the development of waterways in the states of Maharashtra, Karnataka and Tamil Nadu. This initiative aligns with the government's Sagarmala Programme, promoting comprehensive port-led development across India’s coastline.
